org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.support
Class AeLink

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.AeAbstractBpelObject
      org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.support.AeLink
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAeBpelObject, IAeExecutableBpelObject, IAeExecutableQueueItem, IAeFunctionFactory, IAeLink, IAeLocatableObject, IAeNamespaceContext, IAeVisitable
public class AeLink
extends AeAbstractBpelObject
implements IAeLink

Models the links that are defined within a flow. A link has a single source activity and a single target activity. The use of a link ensures that the target activity will not execute until the status of the link is known and it's transition condition is evaluated. The link implementation keeps a reference to the target activity so it can notify the engine when the link's status changes.

getStatus

public boolean getStatus()
Returns the status. If the status of this link is unknown then it'll generate an exception since the spec dictates that you don't evaluate join conditions until the status of all inbound links is known.

Specified by:
getStatus in interface IAeLink
Returns:
true if transition condition met, false if not, exception if not known

Sets status without notifying the process. This is used when restoring the state of a process from its serialized representation.

clearStatus

public void clearStatus()
Clears the status of the link. This is used by flow to reset links before execute. TODO that we may need to trigger an event so listeners can reflact this unknown state.

getChildrenForStateChange

public java.util.Iterator getChildrenForStateChange()
Description copied from interface: IAeBpelObject
Returns an Iterator for the bpel object's child objects which participate in the state change propagation. For structured activities, this merely returns an Iterator for the child activity or activities. In some cases though, like Scope, we're returning objects in addition to the single child activity.
